text:
image. In this example, we deﬁne a convolutional layer with 64 ﬁlter maps and a kernel size
of 2. This is followed by a max pooling layer and a dense layer to interpret the input feature.
An output layer is speciﬁed that predicts a single numerical value. The model is ﬁt using the
eﬃcient Adam version of stochastic gradient descent and optimized using the mean squared
error, or ‘mse’, loss function. Once the model is deﬁned, we can ﬁt it on the training dataset.
# fit model
